result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandy Lee Lameer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
11:40 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Daniel Sondalle.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA recites agreement - defendant will plea to counts 1,2 & 3 as amended to Misdemeanor Theft by employee in violation of 943.20(1)(b), and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Sondalle concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1, 2 & 3 as amended.  Court orders count 4 & 5 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Statement by defendant's father.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Sondalle.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

Counts 1,2 & 3 (EACH) 

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 24 months.

CONDITIONS:

EACH COUNT
-20 days county jail, with huber and consecutive to each other and to commence within 60 days.  Court grants out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.
-Court costs.
-NO Contact with the victims or the place where she was employed.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 11:59 a.m.
Miscellaneous Letters (Character Reference Letters)
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 21, 2016 at 11:30 am.
State's
for Leave to File Additional Motions
Defendant's
for Discovery-Defendant's
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 31, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

10:13 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Dan Sondalle.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court goes over conversation held prior to court.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on May 31, 2016 at 2:00 p.m. 

Court adjourned at 10:14 a.m.
Status hearing on May 3, 2016 at 10:00 am.

2:05 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Daniel Sondalle.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Sondalle - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Sondalle and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Sondalle enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court sets for Status Hearing on May 3, 2016 at 10:00 am. 

Court adjourned at 2:07 p.m.
Waiver of Prelim at 03-15-2016 02:00 pm

11:30 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Daniel Sondalle.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Sondalle - has received an offer and requests another status hearing.  Court sets for Waiver of Preliminary hearing on March 15, 2016 at 2:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 11:31 a.m.
Status hearing at 02-09-2016 11:15 am

2:01 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Dan Sondalle.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Sondalle - requests another status hearing be scheduled.  ADA concurs.  Court sets for Status Hearing on February 9, 2015 at 11:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:02 p.m.
By Atty Daniel Sondalle
Status hearing at 12-22-2015 02:00 pm

9:28 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Dan Sondalle.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Sondalle - will file a Notice of Retainer and requests a pretrial conference.  Court sets for Status Hearing on December 22, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 9:29 a.m.

Status hearing at 11-24-2015 09:15 am

No Contact with Berlin Pines. 9:00 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No Contact with Berlin Pines.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.   Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on November 24, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:02 a,m
